title: Riot, seriously, why donâ€™t you just make Ezreal have to auto for Klepto?
body:
It’s pretty obvious that Klepto keystone is a problem on Ezreal. Why is it a problem? Well, shooting a low cd long range skill shot with relatively low mana cost is giving Ez tons of gold. 

Ez, who is  a champion that desperately needs to hit their item spike ahead of the enemy.

Ez who hits a brick god damn wall once crit based ADCs match him in items. 

So, Riot is taking away damage scaling on a champion that already scales badly vs his crit based counterparts.  This will probably work just a bit. You’ll see his winrate curve move down and  to the left, but it will still be too high before 30 mins.

Trouble is that Ez will absolutely have to take Klepto now to compete.  Eventually when riot wises up and fixes the problem, this will put Ez back where he was before they buffed Q ratio: the dumpster.  He won’t even be able to jungle anymore, most likely, since the Q buffs are what helped enable that.

Riot, please just do the right thing here:

**Make Ezreal auto attack to proc Klepto. This forces him to have to actually trade to proc it like any other ADC.**

Remember: Klepto isn’t even broken on Gangplank, which seemed like the obvious place it would be broken! Why? It’s a point and click spell with much lower range. He can’t blind shoot it into your dumb support or adc that doesn’t stand behind minions.

I realize this is harder than just lol nerfing a damage ratio due to the way Mystic Shot is coded, but it’s what has to be done if you don’t want to nerf Kleptomancy directly.

Proposed Solution:

KLEPTOMANCY - Passive: **~~0.75s~~ 0.6s after using an ability**, your next basic attack within 10 seconds has 25 bonus range. If the attack is against a champion, you gain 5 Gold. Occasionally, you will gain a consumable item instead. If you gain a consumable item while your inventory is full, the consumable will instead be consumed.

By adding in a tiny delay between when Klepto is activated and when it can be proc'ed, abilities that proc on-hit effects cannot both activate AND proc Klepto. Ezreal would have to Q, THEN land an AA to proc it. Meanwhile, everyone else should be just firing an ability then AA'ing to proc Klepto without having to change anything else in their pattern.

~~The delay time might have to be tweaked, as I don't know Ezreal's Q missile speed and max range.~~ Guess it's time to do the math. Ezreal's Q has a missile speed of 2000, and range of 1150. That means when Ezreal shoots a target at max range, the Klepto delay required to prevent his Q from solo triggering the effect is anything more than 0.575s. So, rounding up a bit for clarity's sake, we're looking at a minimum delay of 0.6. Less than my original suggestion of 0.75s, so I'll adjust my suggestion.


This would also suck for those supports with really fast cast times on an ability (Zyra W comes to mind) as they'd have to actually hold off AA'ing for a split second after using those abilities.

> The delay time might have to be tweaked,

0.75s is entirely open to adjustment. As I said, for actual supports there is no real reason to NEED to proc Klepto IMMEDIATELY (read: less than 0.5s after using an ability); hell, other than one of Zyra's abilities and MAYBE Leona's Q, I can't think of any support who'd even notice this. Most supports just care about reliably and continually gathering those consumables. In addition (forgot to note this), based on my understanding of how LoL's spaghetti code works a support's AA travel time itself uses up part of that delay time too as the Klepto on-hit effect is proc'ed - wait for it -  when the autoattack hits, NOT when you start the autoattack animation.
what? How does this ruin it for everyone? Maybe 0.75 is a little too long, but this would only nerf Ez and GP who are both too strong with the rune right now.

I went with 0.75 because Klepto (as far as I understand) is triggered by ability CAST, and proc'ed by AA HIT. Meaning that if the delay is the same or shorter than however long it takes Ezreal's Q to hit a target at max range from cast to impact, this wouldn't change anything. For any champion ability other than one that procs on-hits, though, the only way to trigger Klepto is to first cast the ability, then make an AA. Ergo, so long as 

Ability Cast Time + AA animation time + AA projectile travel time to target < 0.75 seconds
